creditline: Gift of Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts
inscription: upper right, red pigment: à mon ami Lafrance / ABesnard. / 3 juillet 1875
markings: verso frame TR, black ink: A187
provenance: [Neal Fiertag, Paris; to Weisberg]; Yvonne and Gabriel Weisberg, Minneapolis
text: An elegantly dressed man sits sideways on a chair. He wears a monocle over his left eye, and he is neatly groomed with strawberry blonde hair and a full beard and mustache. His left elbow rests on the back of the chair and his head leans on his right hand in a melancholic pose, although his expression is self-assured. The portrait is brightly painted with loose, lively brushwork. At the top right corner there is an inscription in French, which reads, as translated: “to my friend Lafrance, A. Besnard, 3 July 1875.”
title: Portrait of the Sculptor Jules Lafrance
